guys i cant seem to change my config so do i need a program to change it??

The configs are simply text files with a .cfg file extension. Notepad will work fine (unless its a large file like the persistance file), and you could use MS Word too.

I prefer Notepad++ as my text editor

You need an additional folder, BoulderCo, to contain the configs (GameData\BoulderCo\ActiveTextureManagerConfigs). It should be in the download. As for additional configs, Green Skull has made a few packs but I believe they have been incorporated into the OP.
this mod needs updating, it does indeed break some other mods, like final frontier

this mod needs updating, it does indeed break some other mods, like final frontier

I'm running both just fine.

The guy managed to implement texture compression with a *plugin*.

What is Squad doing that they haven't addressed this properly yet? I'm okay without new content, mods are for that, but at least make the game engine solid please.

What is Squad doing that they haven't addressed this properly yet?

For a start, Squad is kinda busy getting the game scope-complete. Fixing bugs, making the actual game code so modders can access and use it etc.. Secondly, texture compression is of no real concern to them - in a stock install as released by the devs, there's no need for it - there just aren't enough textures to warrant compression. But, as I've said before, it would behove Squad to change that outlook in the future because A, the stock game is only going to get bigger and B, there are plenty of popular and large mods around and Squad isn't exactly hostile to modders.

this mod needs updating, it does indeed break some other mods, like final frontier

This also works fine for me, you will need to look at your other mods ATM is not the culprit. Final Frontier does not work if you have mods that add more planets, period.

Might be that

Uh, KSP (Unity) *always* compresses textures (with a couple exceptions: do-not-compress-flagged MBMs and all TGAs will be left uncompressed by design). ATM doesn't change that. It does let you selectively turn compression on and off for specified textures, so that you can compress (or not compress) those files as desired. It also allows you to scale down textures, which (again) KSP does too: that's what the "Texture Resolution: High/Medium/Low" does. It's just that ATM does all of this *better*, and with more flexibility and options, than KSP.
Thanks rbray89! This mod saved me. Interstellar was causing intermittent crashes. After installing your mod everything is the quickness.
I'm still getting RAM crashes, is there a config file I can change, or do I have to cut back on mods?
